intro: Agarista breviflora, commonly known as the short-flowered agarista, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It grows as an erect shrub with opposite, lance-shaped leaves. Agarista breviflora is often found in shaded, humid environments such as forests and undergrowth.
